_meta.note: Primary ICP is the strongest defined profile with highest confidence. Secondary ICPs represent expansion segments. Negative personas help with ad exclusion and messaging focus.

attributes.source: VOC analysis, LMNT customer proxy, Reddit/podcast audience demographics

attributes.definition: Self-identifies as a biohacker or health optimizer. Listens to Huberman Lab, Attia (The Drive), Rhonda Patrick. Values data, science, and evidence over marketing.
attributes.source: Podcast audience overlap analysis, Reddit behavior patterns

attributes.definition: Already takes 3+ supplements daily. Has tried LMNT, Liquid IV, or similar electrolyte products. Spends $100+/month on health and wellness products. Reads labels obsessively.
attributes.source: LMNT review analysis, competitor customer profiles

attributes.definition: Knows that most electrolyte powders are synthetic, processed, and incomplete. Wants a whole-food source with full mineral spectrum but can't find one that meets his standards.
attributes.source: VOC quotes LMNT-031, LMNT-009, Reddit threads

attributes.definition: Is this actually better? Show me the data. How is this different from the $10 stuff at CVS or the $45 LMNT box?
attributes.source: VOC quote LMNT-003, support email patterns

attributes.definition: YouTube (health/science channels), Podcasts (health/biohacking), Reddit (r/Supplements, r/Biohackers, r/keto), Twitter/X (health optimization accounts)

Combination of: (1) science-backed claims with published research, (2) clean label with full transparency, (3) social proof from people he considers credible (not influencers, but scientists/MDs/peers)
attributes.source: Purchase behavior analysis from LMNT reviews, competitor conversion studies

secondary_icps.description: Strict keto or carnivore adherents (2+ years) who experience electrolyte depletion as a side effect of their diet. Already aware of the electrolyte need. Currently buying LMNT, snake juice, or DIY electrolyte mixes.
secondary_icps.why_target: Highest urgency pain point. Most validated by VOC (7+ direct quotes from LMNT reviews). Established buying behavior for electrolyte products. Strong community word-of-mouth potential.

secondary_icps.description: Women 35-55 practicing intermittent or extended fasting for health, weight management, or longevity. Concerned about electrolyte depletion during fasting windows. Sensitive to anything that might break a fast.
secondary_icps.why_target: Large and growing segment (IF popularity increasing). Underserved by current electrolyte brands that include sweeteners/calories. High potential for community-driven growth through fasting Facebook groups.

secondary_icps.description: Runners, cyclists, triathletes, and CrossFitters who train 5+ times per week. Experience cramping, fatigue, and performance decline from electrolyte imbalance. Value performance optimization.
secondary_icps.why_target: Clear performance use case with measurable results. Habitual supplement buyers. Willing to pay premium for proven products. Strong social proof dynamics in athletic communities.

secondary_icps.description: People dealing with chronic fatigue, brain fog, fibromyalgia, or autoimmune conditions. Exploring mineral supplementation as part of broader health protocol. Often recommended marine minerals by functional medicine practitioners.
secondary_icps.why_target: Extremely high lifetime value (daily use, indefinite). Strong emotional connection to solutions that work. Active in support communities with high word-of-mouth. Functional medicine practitioner channel opportunity.

negative_personas.label: General Fitness Casuals
negative_personas.description: People who work out 1-2x per week and just want a sports drink. Not interested in ingredient quality, sourcing, or science. Would never pay premium for electrolytes.
negative_personas.why_exclude: Low willingness-to-pay. High CAC to educate. Will churn after one order. Dilutes brand positioning if targeted. Gatorade and Liquid IV serve this market.

negative_personas.label: Price Shoppers
negative_personas.description: People whose primary decision driver is lowest price per serving. Compare everything on Amazon by price. Will switch for a $2 savings.
negative_personas.why_exclude: Impossible to retain profitably. Zero brand loyalty. Will leave negative reviews comparing price to bulk electrolyte powder. Destroys unit economics.

negative_personas.label: People Who Need Basic Education
negative_personas.description: People who don't yet understand what electrolytes are, why they matter, or why tap water might not be sufficient. Need to be educated from zero.
negative_personas.why_exclude: Extremely high CAC to educate. Long sales cycle. Low conversion rate. IonWave should target people who already understand the need and are looking for a better solution, not people who need to be convinced the problem exists.
